result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dillon T. Ray

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Reserve Judge Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV:  
[MK] cases #16CF42, #16CF106, #16CM134 called at 11:57am.
Defendant Dillon T. Ray in court with Attorney Jeffrey J De La Rosa.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Waiver of Preliminary Hearing held in Case #16CF106:
--Mr. Ray waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.
--ADA Hall files an Information
--service of Information admitted, reading waived

On Motion of the State, the Court amends Count #1 of Case #16CF42 to Class A Misdemeanor Battery contrary to Statute 940.19(1) & 939.05.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered on Counts #1 & #2 of Case #16CF42 and on Count #1 of Case #16CF106; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2 of Case #16CF106, and all counts in Case #16CM134.

On Case #16CF42-Counts #1 & #2, and on Case #16CF106-Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Mr. Ray on Probation for two years, with conditions:

----On Case #16CF106 only to serve 30 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to commence forthwith
----to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
 per the Agent 
----to undergo any assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
----no acts or threats of violence toward any person
----to maintain absolute sobriety: no alcohol, no controlled substances other than those authorized by appropriate prescription
----to take all prescription drugs as prescribed
----no contact with Todd Knoll, William Lawrence, or Justin Magsamen
----to engage in a Criminal Thinking and/or Anger Management program per the Agent
----to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--On Case #16CF42 only: to pay restitution of $251 to Todd Knoll
--On Case #16CF106: to pay restitution to Optum in an amount to be determined at a Restitution Hearing; however if the entity known as Optum has not responded to the Distric Attorney's Office request for clarification andfurther data in support of its restitution request by the Restitution Hearing date, then the hearing will be taken off the calendar and no restitution is ordered in Caes #16CF106 
--to pay costs and surcharges on each count 

--to provide a DNA sample 

Days credit for time already served:  1 day in Case #16CF42,  0 days in Case #16CF106 
The Court grants the Defendant's request to be allowed to petition for Expungment [upon the successful conclusion of the Probation term] in Case #16CF106.
recess 12:33pm. 

NEXT:  Restitution Hearing before Judge Nettesheim on 6/3/16 at 3:00pm
It is ORDERED that the continuance is granted and the new time appointed is April 29, 2016 at 11:00am
Status conference on April 29, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on April 29, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on April 6, 2016 at 10:20 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Dillon T. Ray
Current: 710 Franklin St, Apt 2, Watertown, WI 53094 United States  (Effective: 03-14-2016)
Prior: 710 Franklin St., Watertown, WI 53094 United States

ADDRESS INFO for Dillon T. Ray
Current: 710 Franklin St., Watertown, WI 53094 United States  (Effective: 03-10-2016)
Prior: N8370 North St, Ixonia, WI 53036
Original Bond Document received from JESO on 3/11/16

Cases 16CF42 16CF106, and 16CM134 called together at 1:22
Defendant Dillon T. Ray in court, in custody with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.  ADA Monica J. Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Cases 16CF106 and 16CM134 (Initial Appearance occurs):
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

As to Case 16CM134:
The Court requires $750  signature bond, with conditions: 
--to maintain absolute 
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no possession or consumption of illegal drugs
--take all prescription drugs as prescribed
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--to commit no acts or threats of violence towards any person
--no contact with Justin Magsamen or Cheyenne Marx

As to Case 16CF106:
The Court requires $1000  signature bond, with conditions: 
--to maintain absolute 
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no possession or consumption of illegal drugs
--take all prescription drugs as prescribed
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--to commit no acts or threats of violence towards any person

ADA Hall orally motions for an amendment to bond in case 16CF42; gives arguments
--bond arguments given by Atty. De La Rosa 
--questioning by the Court

In Case 16CF42, the Court amends the bond to $250 CASH,
--to maintain absolute 
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no possession or consumption of illegal drugs
--take all prescription drugs as prescribed
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--to commit no acts or threats of violence towards any person

Parties waive time limits in all cases
Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.
recess: 1:40pm


NEXT: AS TO ALL CASES: (1) Pretrial Conference on 4/6/16 at 10:20am    (2)  Status Conference on 4/29/16 at 3:00pm
